ingredients.name: of sirine cheese or sheep feta cheese grated

instructions.heading: Preparing the Crust
steps: 1. Put all the vegetables in a large bowl and drizzle with olive oil.
2. Mix all together and separate into four bowls or plates.
3. Cover with cheese as much as you like.
4. Garnish with parsley and olives if using.
5. Serve immediately.

ingredients.name: eggs (beaten, 2 for crust and 2 for filling)
salt (1 tbsp for crust, 1 tbsp for filling)

instructions.heading: Preparing the Crust
steps: Combine all the ingredients except for the butter/margarine.
Knead the dough until reaching a springy consistency. Add water or flour if necessary.
Whack the dough against the table a few times (for consistency)
Let the dough rest for around 45 minutes.
Cut the dough into two pieces and spread them nicely with some melted butter.

instructions.heading: Preparing the Filling
steps: Wash the cabbage/spinach and squeeze out the moisture (as much as possible).
Cut the white cheese into tiny crumbles.
Beat the eggs.
Combine everything together (including other optional ingredients).

instructions.heading: Baking the Pie
steps: Set the oven to 380 F (250 degrees Celcius).
Use a thin rolling pin to roll out the first piece of dough.
After rolling out the dough, lay it in the pan and make sure it 's spread out evenly.
Brush some melted butter on the top.
Roll out the second piece of dough.Pull it with your fingers and make sure you stretch.it as much as possible. Don 't worry if there are tiny holes.
Add the filling to the frying pan.
Pick up the top dough with the rolling pin and make plenty of ripples with the filling.
Adjust the layers and make sure everything is covered.
Brush some melted butter on the top and turn down the edges with a slight twisting motion.
Add the zelnik to the oven and bake for 30 - 35 minutes.Remove when the top starts getting a light brown color.

instructions.heading: Notes
steps: * Don't add the filling before completing the second layer. I know this sounds tempting, but if the first layer sits too long, the bottom dough can get quite soggy and ruin the whole recipe.
* When baking, check the oven after 15 - 20 minutes. If the top already starts getting brown, add some parchment paper on the top to make sure the zelnik doesn't burn.
